013package org.apache.juneau.reflect;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
017import java.util.concurrent.*;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.util.*;
021
022/**
023 * Cache of object that convert POJOs to and from common types such as strings, readers, and input streams.
024 *
025 * <ul class='seealso'>
026 * </ul>
027 */
028public class Mutaters {
029   private static final ConcurrentHashMap<Class<?>,Map<Class<?>,Mutater<?,?>>> CACHE = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
030
031   /**
032    * Represents a non-existent transform.
033    */
034   public static final Mutater<Object,Object> NULL = new Mutater<Object,Object>() {
035      @Override
036      public Object mutate(Object outer, Object in) {
037         return null;
038      }
039   };
040
041   // Special cases.
042   static {
043
044      // TimeZone doesn't follow any standard conventions.
045      add(String.class, TimeZone.class,
046         new Mutater<String,TimeZone>() {
047            @Override public TimeZone mutate(Object outer, String in) {
048               return TimeZone.getTimeZone(in);
049            }
050         }
051      );
052      add(TimeZone.class, String.class,
053         new Mutater<TimeZone,String>() {
054            @Override public String mutate(Object outer, TimeZone in) {
055               return in.getID();
056            }
057         }
058      );
059
060      // Locale(String) doesn't work on strings like "ja_JP".
061      add(String.class, Locale.class,
062         new Mutater<String,Locale>() {
063            @Override
064            public Locale mutate(Object outer, String in) {
065               return Locale.forLanguageTag(in.replace('_', '-'));
066            }
067         }
068      );
069
070      // String-to-Boolean transform should allow for "null" keyword.
071      add(String.class, Boolean.class,
072         new Mutater<String,Boolean>() {
073            @Override
074            public Boolean mutate(Object outer, String in) {
075               if (in == null || "null".equals(in) || in.isEmpty())
076                  return null;
077               return Boolean.valueOf(in);
078            }
079         }
080      );
081   }
082
083   /**
084    * Adds a transform for the specified input/output types.
085    *
086    * @param ic The input type.
087    * @param oc The output type.
088    * @param t The transform for converting the input to the output.
089    */
090   public static synchronized void add(Class<?> ic, Class<?> oc, Mutater<?,?> t) {
091      Map<Class<?>,Mutater<?,?>> m = CACHE.get(oc);
092      if (m == null) {
093         m = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
094         CACHE.put(oc, m);
095      }
096      m.put(ic, t);
097   }
098
099   /**
100    * Returns the transform for converting the specified input type to the specified output type.
101    *
102    * @param <I> The input type.
103    * @param <O> The output type.
104    * @param ic The input type.
105    * @param oc The output type.
106    * @return The transform for performing the conversion, or <jk>null</jk> if the conversion cannot be made.
107    */
108   @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
109   public static <I,O> Mutater<I,O> get(Class<I> ic, Class<O> oc) {
110
111      if (ic == null || oc == null)
112         return null;
113
114      Map<Class<?>,Mutater<?,?>> m = CACHE.get(oc);
115      if (m == null) {
116         m = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
117         CACHE.putIfAbsent(oc, m);
118         m = CACHE.get(oc);
119      }
120
121      Mutater t = m.get(ic);
122
123      if (t == null) {
124         t = find(ic, oc, m);
125         m.put(ic, t);
126      }
127
128      return t == NULL ? null : t;
129   }
130
131   /**
132    * Returns the transform for converting the specified input type to the specified output type.
133    *
134    * @param <I> The input type.
135    * @param <O> The output type.
136    * @param ic The input type.
137    * @param oc The output type.
138    * @return The transform for performing the conversion, or <jk>null</jk> if the conversion cannot be made.
139    */
140   public static <I,O> boolean hasMutate(Class<I> ic, Class<O> oc) {
141      return get(ic, oc) != NULL;
142   }
143
144   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
145   private static Mutater find(Class<?> ic, Class<?> oc, Map<Class<?>,Mutater<?,?>> m) {
146
147      if (ic == oc) {
148         return new Mutater() {
149            @Override public Object mutate(Object outer, Object in) {
150               return in;
151            }
152         };
153      }
154
155      ClassInfo ici = ClassInfo.of(ic), oci = ClassInfo.of(oc);
156
157      ClassInfo pic = ici.getAnyParent(x -> m.get(x.inner()) != null);
158      if (pic != null)
159         return m.get(pic.inner());
160
161      if (ic == String.class) {
162         Class<?> oc2 = oci.hasPrimitiveWrapper() ? oci.getPrimitiveWrapper() : oc;
163         ClassInfo oc2i = ClassInfo.of(oc2);
164
165         final MethodInfo createMethod = oc2i.getPublicMethod(
166            x -> x.isStatic()
167            && x.isNotDeprecated()
168            && x.hasReturnType(oc2)
169            && x.hasParamTypes(ic)
170            && (x.hasName("forName") || isStaticCreateMethodName(x, ic))
171         );
172
173         if (oc2.isEnum() && createMethod == null) {
174            return new Mutater<String,Object>() {
175               @Override
176               public Object mutate(Object outer, String in) {
177                  return Enum.valueOf((Class<? extends Enum>)oc2, in);
178               }
179            };
180         }
181
182         if (createMethod != null) {
183            return new Mutater<String,Object>() {
184               @Override
185               public Object mutate(Object outer, String in) {
186                  try {
187                     return createMethod.invoke(null, in);
188                  } catch (Exception e) {
189                     throw asRuntimeException(e);
190                  }
191               }
192            };
193         }
194      } else {
195         MethodInfo createMethod = oci.getPublicMethod(
196            x -> x.isStatic()
197            && x.isNotDeprecated()
198            && x.hasReturnType(oc)
199            && x.hasParamTypes(ic)
200            && isStaticCreateMethodName(x, ic)
201         );
202
203         if (createMethod != null) {
204            Method cm = createMethod.inner();
205            return new Mutater() {
206               @Override
207               public Object mutate(Object context, Object in) {
208                  try {
209                     return cm.invoke(null, in);
210                  } catch (Exception e) {
211                     throw asRuntimeException(e);
212                  }
213               }
214            };
215         }
216      }
217
218      ConstructorInfo c = oci.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(ic));
219      if (c != null && c.isNotDeprecated()) {
220         boolean isMemberClass = oci.isNonStaticMemberClass();
221         return new Mutater() {
222            @Override
223            public Object mutate(Object outer, Object in) {
224               try {
225                  if (isMemberClass)
226                     return c.invoke(outer, in);
227                  return c.invoke(in);
228               } catch (Exception e) {
229                  throw asRuntimeException(e);
230               }
231            }
232         };
233      }
234
235      MethodInfo toXMethod = findToXMethod(ici, oci);
236      if (toXMethod != null) {
237         return new Mutater() {
238            @Override
239            public Object mutate(Object outer, Object in) {
240               try {
241                  return toXMethod.invoke(in);
242               } catch (Exception e) {
243                  throw asRuntimeException(e);
244               }
245            }
246         };
247      }
248
249      return NULL;
250   }
251
252   private static boolean isStaticCreateMethodName(MethodInfo mi, Class<?> ic) {
253      String n = mi.getSimpleName(), cn = ic.getSimpleName();
254      return isOneOf(n, "create","from","fromValue","parse","valueOf")
255         || (n.startsWith("from") && n.substring(4).equals(cn))
256         || (n.startsWith("for") && n.substring(3).equals(cn))
257         || (n.startsWith("parse") && n.substring(5).equals(cn));
258   }
259
260   /**
261    * Constructs a new instance of the specified class from the specified string.
262    *
263    * <p>
264    * Class must be one of the following:
265    * <ul>
266    *    <li>Have a public constructor that takes in a single <c>String</c> argument.
267    *    <li>Have a static <c>fromString(String)</c> (or related) method.
268    *    <li>Be an <c>enum</c>.
269    * </ul>
270    *
271    * @param <T> The class type.
272    * @param c The class type.
273    * @param s The string to create the instance from.
274    * @return A new object instance, or <jk>null</jk> if a method for converting the string to an object could not be found.
275    */
276   public static <T> T fromString(Class<T> c, String s) {
277      Mutater<String,T> t = get(String.class, c);
278      return t == null ? null : t.mutate(s);
279   }
280
281   /**
282    * Converts an object to a string.
283    *
284    * <p>
285    * Normally, this is just going to call <c>toString()</c> on the object.
286    * However, the {@link Locale} and {@link TimeZone} objects are treated special so that the returned value
287    * works with the {@link #fromString(Class, String)} method.
288    *
289    * @param o The object to convert to a string.
290    * @return The stringified object, or <jk>null</jk> if the object was <jk>null</jk>.
291    */
292   @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked" })
293   public static String toString(Object o) {
294      if (o == null)
295         return null;
296      Mutater<Object,String> t = (Mutater<Object,String>)get(o.getClass(), String.class);
297      return t == null ? o.toString() : t.mutate(o);
298   }
299
300   private static MethodInfo findToXMethod(ClassInfo ic, ClassInfo oc) {
301      String tn = oc.getReadableName();
302      return ic.getPublicMethod(
303         x -> x.isNotStatic()
304         && x.hasNoParams()
305         && x.getSimpleName().startsWith("to")
306         && x.getSimpleName().substring(2).equalsIgnoreCase(tn)
307      );
308   }
309}
